Speaker: agent 1
Dialogue: This is the first time an Intruder has broken into X-Net!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: I got a lock. Coordinate 32937!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I said WHICH WAY DID HE GO?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Come on guys! Nobody hacks X-Net. You gonna let him get away?!

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Rush, I think I found him!

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Check the old game grid!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You get a cookie, Miles!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I haven't played this since I was 4. But I was mighty awesome.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Score an ID on this leech?

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Negative.    He's nobody.

Speaker: kelter
Dialogue: Rush, you've gotta nail him.

Speaker: phlegman
Dialogue: Or you know we're all fired.

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Whoa, Rush! I groked a pattern in his moves! Fake left, go right!

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: You got him on the run, dude!

Speaker: others
Dialogue: Crash him!   Rush RUSH RUSH.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Yikes!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: He crashed me!

Speaker: nerds
Dialogue: FUBAR!    Bad Thing!   Flame War!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Miles.    Did you get a trace on him?!

Speaker: phlegman
Dialogue: We are so screwed.

Speaker: kelter
Dialogue: Who tells the boss?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Get the system back up!     Now!    Move!

Speaker: pr vp
Dialogue: Weather is holding. Dress rehearsal on for 6PM. In the morning, we let the press in for a 7AM tech set-up, then you go live worldwide 9 AM sharp.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Delay the press until 8:30. I'll taking the stage at 8:50. Force a network break-in. Then it's news.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Play that again.

Speaker: video playback
Dialogue: X-Net deploys radical software design, constructs proprietary white-hot firewalls, unleashes virus killer apps. Creating the most secure data network in history. Your data can never again be hacked, corrupted, stolen or destroyed. X-Net is the final solution, totally guaranteed

Speaker: pr vp
Dialogue: Um, that would be...    Legal.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Change it back to the way I wrote it. With the launch of X-Net, this company guarantees one hundred percent secure data transmission. If we can't deliver on that promise, we deserve to be out of business.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: What can't wait, Rush?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Um. X-Net was just breached by a hacker.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: System's back up, no permanent damage, but... But whoever's behind this, they're good, and they're still out there.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Identify the intruder.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Identity not captured.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: How did he enter X-Net?

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: How could you let this happen?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: I do what you programmed me to do. I am constructing X-Net.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: New instructions - find and destroy the intruder!

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: No. We can't delay the opening of X- Net. Disregard my last command. Maintain construction priority.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: System is stable again, keep you fingers crossed.

Speaker: phlegman
Dialogue: Any luck finding the intruder?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Don't ask.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: What's she doing here?    This is an operations meeting.

Speaker: kelter
Dialogue: You and Meg still, eh...    At it?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: There was never anything between us.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: She's Advanced Projects.    This has nothing to do with her.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: This company's existence depends on the flawless launch of X-Net in twenty- two hours, fifty-one minutes. Now somebody - some hacker, some competitor, somebody - just proved they're smarter than us. Breaking into X-Net is theoretically impossible.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: This creep's the best I've ever seen. He crosses platforms, cracks 128 bit encryption, cloaks every move, never leaves a trace.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: When you find him, I'll be sure to hire him.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Boys and girls, we cannot sell a secure network that is not secure.

Speaker: pr vp
Dialogue: We delay the launch.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: And the world assumes we've got a faulty product. And they'd be right.

Speaker: kelter
Dialogue: We ramp up our encryption schemes -

Speaker: phlegman
Dialogue: Thicken all firewalls -

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: We can't win playing defense. And it's a bigger job than just swatting an intruder program. Somewhere, there's a human mind behind this thing. We have to get to that User and shut him - or her - down, or the game never ends.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: What do you need, Rush?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: 20 guys for 20 days -

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: We don't have 20 hours. This problem needs to be gone before tomorrow 9AM. Come on people, this company's future is at stake! It's time to think without a box!

Speaker: rudy
Dialogue: At a time like this, let's seek inspiration in the past. We should ask ourselves: What solution would spring from the inspired mind of our departed leader, Flynn.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Is the QF-401 is operational?

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Um...   Midway into phase one testing.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: If we can't fight this intruder from the outside, then maybe we need to fight him from the inside.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: I'm ready to do my part.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: This company needs a hero. Who among you is the smartest, most resourceful and courageous?

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Who else could it be?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Somebody going to tell me what I've been volunteered for?

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Rush, you're the only one I can trust to eliminate the intruder. But you won't be doing it the way you thought. Meg's been working on something down here that's, well... Beyond Top Secret.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: This is where Flynn worked.   And where he died.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Meg has reconstructed Flynn's last project. This time it works.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You didn't pick this up at Circuit City. What is it?

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: A Quantum Digitizer. Prototype, only one of its kind. Flynn designed it to break down physical objects into high resolution data. Luckily, we salvaged his key components and back-engineered the system.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: That's...   Not possible.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Flynn was trying to take it one step further. He wanted to transport a human being into cyberspace.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You mean the urban legends? A computer sucked Flynn into cyberspace a long time ago.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: We think it happened.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: It was a fluke. But Flynn worked for years, down here, trying to make it happen again. One day a test went bad. A plasma reaction destroyed this lab. Flynn was reduced to ash.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I was never told how he died. It was all just weird, you know, because Flynn's the guy who hired me. But he was strange, kept to himself, I didn't know what job I was supposed to be doing.  Then you came onboard, the company woke up, we had a direction. It was kind of pathetic, because by the time Flynn died, everybody was too busy to care.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: He was brilliant in his way, but genius without discipline leads to nothing. His reckless habits nearly ruined this company... And for sure got him killed.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: That kind of accident can't happen again. We've upgraded the system in ways Flynn never could. The chips didn't exist until now.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Hey, Jo-Jo.    Have good trip?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You want her to send me into cyberspace to catch that jerk who hacked us?

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: The future of this company depends on it.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You can bring me back okay?

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Ask Jo-Jo.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Destroy the intruder by 9AM tomorrow, Rush. I know if anyone can, it's you. I've had my eye on you for a long time. Score this hit and I'll make you my full partner in this company.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I won't let you down.   Let's do it.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: I promise I'll get you back safely by 9AM tomorrow. But you have to promise me something too -

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You're a piece of work. You dumped me because you said I was too much about the company's needs and not enough about yours. Well here we are, the company needs their best guy, and you just can't admit how much to hurts to nominate me.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: This bigger than us, Rush. Listen to me. I don't know what you're going to find in there, but whatever it is, promise you'll follow your heart and do the right thing.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Oh.    So you think I have a heart?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I promise.

Speaker: dewey
Dialogue: It's overloading!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: What's happening?!

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: System is losing stability!

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: There's been another breech!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It's the Intruder again!

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: We have to abort!

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: We might not get another chance!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: DO IT!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It's YOU!    The intruder!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You are...    TRON?!?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: ARRRGHH!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Uh, well, I'm not exactly -

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: RX23 reboot was not authorized!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Yow.     I know who programmed you.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I am Mega, X-Net Intelligence.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Mega.     Cool.     I am -

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: A spy? Posing as RX23? Under which register were you rebooted?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I'm a User.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Detain this impostor.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: No wait, look. We're on the same side here. I got an ID on the intruder!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: "Tron"?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Plexor must know of this!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Plexor.   This is the one.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: My name is Rush. I'm a - Look, I got an ID on the Intruder. Do you know the program they used to call Tron?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: You are in error. Zero match.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Exactly. That's how he's getting past you. You don't see him for what he is. He's one of your own, gone bad. Tron was a crude security program from Encom's old days. Strictly low-rez, right? Archived and forgotten. But his source code contains all the architecture of every Encom system, including X-net.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: "User"?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: People. Like me. From the outside. People who write all of your instructions.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: He displays random instability.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Users do not exist.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: How do we contact Sinclair?    He'll explain.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Define "Sinclair".

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You don't know? Oh geez. There must be a way to link him into this.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Zero match for a "Sinclair".

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: He's your boss. Everybody's boss. Outside, in the real world.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Assuming the existence of a world beyond this, is a fatal error.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Plexor issues all commands.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Okay. Sorry. I'm a program, guess I got a piece of my code corrupted. Whatever it is, it's given me power over Tron.  They saw me read his circuits. Can any other program do that?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: He creates alternative data channels at will.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Chaos.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm a little unstable.    But I can find Tron for you.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Release him.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Interface with this one. Exploit his ability. Locate the program "Tron" and destroy him on sight.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Instructions received, Plexor.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I need to find a program called KROD. He's a specialist in pattern recognition. He snagged the last known position on Tron for me.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: This is a waste of X-Net resources. You're strictly random. We will never find the intruder this way.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Plexor ordered us to work together. You can't doubt his instructions, right?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Of course not. But I am programmed to predict all possible errors. You contain an infinite quantity.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Meg for sure programmed you.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I have no data on "Meg".

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Never mind.    I'm being random.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: X-Net is amazing. It's going to change everything. Unless one rogue program called Tron brings it down. Do you believe he could?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I calculated the probability.  He could crash it all.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: So we're working together on this?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: As instructed, I will interface.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: The program "KROD" is over there.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: What a dump.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hey.    Interface.

Dialogue: Three more hub cities have been attacked by viruses!  But X-Net opens soon! You will travel in total security!

Dialogue: This is the one you seek?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It's gotta be -

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Krod!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Krod!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah -     Heeey!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: The best pattern recognition program ever.  This guy can filter a river of junk data and pull out the good stuff.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: You know it, dude!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Who is this guy?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Miles - I mean Krod, you flew the search engine. You ran a trace on a hotshot lightcycle rider. The red guy. Remember?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Well. Eh. I'd like to help you, but truth is, I just got rebooted from a big crash. There's nothing left in my memory from before.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: This will yield zero.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hang on.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Remember, Krod? You were watching this lightcycle duel, a red guy and a green guy, head-to-head.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: The green guy faked out the red guy, but the red guy double-faked the green guy.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Okay! YES! And the green guy splattered big time! It was awesome! How could I forget that?!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Where did the red guy go after that? You didn't crash right away.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: He escaped out this hidden exit -

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: THAT GUY!   The RED GUY!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Did you jack his coordinate?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: And the green guy was YOU! You got rebooted?! They called you, um - Don't tell me, I got it, eh -

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Call me Rush.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Yeah! Whatever. You're good. How'd you do that thing with your hands?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It's complicated. You're coming with us to the old game grid. We're going to find Tron and shut him down.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Beats working.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Hey babe.   Did I ever know you?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: The old game grid is this way -

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: How do I uplink to the real world?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: The real world doesn't exist. Nobody can uplink. These ports were for simulation only.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Right... But how did those poor misguided fools boot up the link?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: They stood in the center.   Held their disk above their head.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Stay on it!    Nobody sleeps!

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: There's a message on your secure link!

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Where is this coming from - ?

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: It's HIM.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: My God, he's there.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Rush, it's Sinclair and Meg.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I identified the intruder.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Tron? Wasn't Tron one of our programs?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I have a plan to crash Tron.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: ABORT!

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Rush?

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: He'd better not fail. 30

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hey! Double points if you nail me! Bring it on!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Stop!    End your routine!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Cease!    Desist! We're on the same team!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I'm X-Net too!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: No, hey, hey big guy, don't take it so hard. We all have bad days.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: He was carrying out his programming. All I/O Ports are scheduled for de- rezz.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Easy, big guy. No harm, no foul.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: D-Rezz, we can use a guy with your raw power. You ready to be a hero for X-Net?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Cool. Now I've got somebody I can boss around.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Or not.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Let's get to the game grid.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: You have a skill for manipulating other programs.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: When do I get a shot at hacking your code?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Never. Our operating systems are incompatible.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You act like I've got a virus.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: There it is.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: The place we nail Tron.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: D-rezz.   Cut a path.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: That's good.     Keep doing it.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Relax, buddy -

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Pound him to bits, D-rezz.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: He's wireless.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Freaky.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Searching data bank. "I-Beem". Security Specialist, damaged in service, rated unstable.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: D-rezz, take out this blip.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hang on. I-Beem. We're from X-Net CPU. You're doing a great job out here. Everybody knows it.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: That's right. Now, have you seen a rogue Program around here? He's red. Super fast. Known as "Tron".

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: When did he come through last?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I-beem, we've got a plan to shut down that red violator. You're going to help us.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: First, you've got to let us onto the game grid.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: This region is obsolete.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: There's bits of Tron's code all over. Krod, give D-Rezz and I-beem the escape coordinate Tron used on me.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: That's where Tron will bail out. We'll make sure he needs to. Go set up the trap.  You only get one shot at this, big guy. Stop him but don't destroy him, right? He's got data I need.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: If this is Tron's territory, he'll know we're here. He'll hide.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: He can't resist a grudge match. He'll take risks trying to beat me. That's how we trip him up.  Whip it out.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: You didn't bring one?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I don't have one.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Hey, not a problem -

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: - Hop on!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hang on, Krod.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I upgraded my unit.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: You are awesome, man.    I hate you.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Mmmm...   Hack me.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Resource conflict!    Fatal crash imminent!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Any sign of him?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Everything looks the same to me. Everything looks the same. The same. The same.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Krod, snap out of it.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Tron will never expose himself.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: The same...

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Its futile.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Look.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Remember the plan, Krod. Don't bail out until the last millisecond.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hang on tight, Mega.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Mmmm.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Wuss!   You call that speed!?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Hey, what are you - ??

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: No!   It's ME!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: WHY DID YOU DO THAT?!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I-    I GOT SCARED!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: There he goes!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: We've got him now.    Let's go!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: I could have done that.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: We can't go any further.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Don't ask, dude.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: It's a memory leak, once it starts, it infects everything.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I agree.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Then it's settled.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Stop. Listen to me. You might not believe there's a world outside of this one, but let's just say a guy named Sinclair is depending on me. If Tron got through here, then I can too. Who's with me?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Good. I-beem, take D-rezz, see what's up ahead. We'll guard this portal until you come back.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Better show me how to use mine.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: No problem. It's all in the velocity- vector ratio.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Report.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: We interfaced with Tron.   He escaped into a dark zone.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: The Random One has proven effective?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: He is all glitches and bad data. He virtually got us de-rezzed. I recommend we terminate this mission.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: No. Proceed. If you keep Tron on the run, he cannot attack X-Net.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: It's a poor allocation of resources.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: You have your instructions.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: "All glitches and bad data." What's up with you? Ever since I got here, you've been working against me.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I act as Plexor programs me.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Blah blah blah. You've got you own processor. I can feel it working overtime. Did Meg program you to mess with me?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I have no match for "Meg" -

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: First, you don't want to come with me, then you're all over me on the light cycle - so you can dump us over and blow the plan. We would have nailed Tron by now if it wasn't for you. What's your malfunction?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Don't troubleshoot me!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: The most effective alternative is to return to the main CPU and anticipate Tron's next attack.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: You ram hog!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It's what I'm programmed to do.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: What were you doing with her?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Nothing. She had a glitch.      I was just pinging her EPROM.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: She let you?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: We've got him now. 44

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Guys!   Go around - behind Tron!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Ouch!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hey!   Pick on somebody your own size!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You've got no data on me.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: D-rezz, pull me up!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hang on, man! HANG ON!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: NOOOO!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I know who you are. Encom security program Tr856 - TRON!

Dialogue: Who is your User??

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Who programmed you?? I know your encryption code. Tell me your User or I shut you down.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I can shut you down with a nine digit code. WHO IS YOUR USER?? 392 -

Dialogue: Tell me, Tron! Who programmed you? Here's your encryption code! 3-6-2- 6-6-8 -

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: You got him!

Dialogue: Game over, dude.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It's more than I wanted. Now I'll never know who his User is.

Dialogue: We're heroes!

Dialogue: They'll give us a slot in the main server!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Rush, now you can finish pinging Mega's EPROM!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Where is Mega?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Right behind me.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: MEGA??

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Mega...

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: I recognize... Trouble.

Dialogue: I-beem, go for help.      Zap your butt out of here.

Dialogue: A User shows up.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Yeah, I'm a User. A superior being. The first to enter this realm. And you are - ?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: The first.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Flynn.   How can you be here?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: You know this dude?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Yeah, he's a lunatic!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Rush Nortebi. I remember hiring you.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Somebody tipped these guys off about us.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Not soon enough.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: You weren't supposed to beat Tron. I thought for sure he'd finish you.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: You destroyed our last hope!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: I detect a pattern in her behavior.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: She's a spy.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: No wonder I couldn't figure it out. I assumed Tron User was on the outside! If I'd known this, I would blown past him and come straight for you.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I failed our cause.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: You did everything you could.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Flynn never died...  Because your Quantum Digitizer worked. That's how you got here... I know - that's how I got here too.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: The day after I hired you, you start sucking up to Sinclair. You thought I didn't know. Bet he offered your a partnership for this, right? You have no idea the damage you've done.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I'm only getting started. Man, you were the company joke. Now I see why. You melted down your lab to take this little joyride. You got stuck here so all you can do is wreck other people's hard work.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Open your eyes, geek. My lab was rigged. My "death" was no accident. I pushed the button just in time to escape... Almost in time.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You're paranoid. Who would want you dead?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: The same guy I programmed Tron to shut down. Same one you've been sucking up to. Sinclair. And his cyber-henchman, Plexor.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Too many of your brain cells have gotten zapped in here, old man.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Rush, you lamer! You've been working for the bad guy.

Speaker: fighter one
Dialogue: He got away.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Let's move. X-Net goons will soon be all over this place.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: I hired Sinclair as Encom's business guy, so I could do the dreaming. Right off, he wanted to "capture the market" on data transmission. Had this plan called "X-Net", based on flawless efficiency, hyperlock security, encryption protocol uniformity. Blah blah. I was the boss, I told him to forget it. I knew it could go bad. But the guy had trouble taking no for an answer. He arranged for my lab to melt down. Sinclair took over my company and put X-Net on a fast-track. And here's where it's brought us.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: What are they doing??

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Beating the competition.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: They've got us outnumbered.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: We've got to choose our battles wisely. This way!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Rush, why is X-Net doing this?!

Speaker: kid program
Dialogue: No!   Let my daddy go!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: How long has this been going on?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: For years.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Sinclair never told us about this. X-Net is creating the very terror that makes people want the security of X-net!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: No more glitches, freeze-ups or shut- downs. Once X-Net is open, Plexor will destroy all other systems. All data flow will be controlled by his Master User -

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Sinclair.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: All data flow - Sinclair's to control and abuse. Bank accounts, medical histories, your Blockbuster account, your buying patterns, your e-mail. And to think, Rush - all this time, you've been working 24/7, trying to impress a him.

Speaker: gps voice
Dialogue: Turn left now. Turn right now. Left. Right. NOW!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Sinclair betrayed me.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Finally you get it.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Tron was our late hope.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: We've got to stop this!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Rush was trying to expose us!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: They didn't see us.   Keep moving!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: We've got to tell people on the outside -

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Plexor shut down all the I/O ports. Only HE communicates with the outside. Sinclair holds all the cards.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: How did you get here?!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Megan Randall sent me.  Her User. She fixed your lab and sent me here to take out Tron.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Megan Randall? I remember her. Smart, wise beyond her years. I can't believe she'd fall for Sinclair's lies.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: What happened to them?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Try to attack Plexor head-on, this is what happens. Because of you, there will be millions more.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Lock up these two. We'll hold them for ransom. Or use them for target practice.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Flynn. You think I'm Sinclair's flunky, but I'm not.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I'm sorry about Tron.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Yeah, we're - Sorry?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: We were just doing a job, we had no way of knowing the truth.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: No way at all.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Flynn, I was wrong about you. You've been doing the right thing in here. Plexor has to be shut down. Sinclair has to be exposed.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Like he said.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Krod and I are ready to help.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: We are?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Mega, what do you read in him?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Independent operating instructions.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You don't know me.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: He cannot to be trusted.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Trust?! You're the one who's been lying to me the whole time!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Mega's been risking her existence for our cause, lamer. That's more than you'll ever do.  Lock them away!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Yo, s'up?     Eh... X-Net rules, man.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hey Krod...     Shut down.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: You are positive Tron was destroyed?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: He is but a randomized Program, he got lucky. To our benefit.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Flynn??

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Flynn... is here? He is the one behind this scheme to crash X-Net?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: And what of Mega?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Tron is gone, but his User lives?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Good work does not go unrewarded at X-Net. Would you like to be upgraded?

Speaker: marketing vp
Dialogue: You're not going to believe this!

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Convince me.

Speaker: marketing vp
Dialogue: Sales office has been flooded with calls. Major banks, airlines, city governments, the presidents of 26 nations - They all want to sign up for X-Net now. We're not even on- line yet and we're a hit!

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: We're the only port in the storm.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Brilliant.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: What uncertainy?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: The User called Flynn is here.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: That's impossible.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Flynn commanded the intruder Tron.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: You've got to be wrong about this.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: I was programmed error-free.      By you.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Flynn...     escaped?!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: He leads a group who seek to prevent the opening of X-Net. The one called Rush has joined them.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Rush? My guy? What lies has Flynn filled him with?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Or what truths?

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: This world can never know all I have done. You have a plan to contain Flynn?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Don't just contain him.    Destroy him.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Instructions received.    And the one called Rush?

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: He knows too much. Get rid of him.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Instructions received.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hear that, Krod? Never let them get to your weak spot.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Gurfle!   I never knew that.

Speaker: boole
Dialogue: We're ready for you now.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: If X-Net is allowed to open it's the beginning of the end of a free and open cyberspace. We can't let Plexor get away with this. Our game plan has not changed. Tron was specially programmed to break into X-Net and shut down power supplies. We would then exploit these weak points and cripple the system. Tron's role was essential One of you must take his place.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Who among you can power Tron's disk and carry out his mission?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: It's the most dangerous job. If you're not up for it, nobody's going to blame you.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: There are other ways to crash Plexor. I will return to him, he still trusts me. I will get close and crash him with direct contact -

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: It's futile. Plexor's personal defense measures are massive.

Speaker: fighter sentry
Dialogue: Enemy scouts, headed this way!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Disperse to all sectors!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: This was a preferred gaming arena for the User called Flynn. His moves are predictable, recursive, easily traced.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: That way!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Down there.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Fan out!    Search every buffer and cache!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Dude, are we glad to see you!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: You destroyed Tron.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Yes...    Where is Mega?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: She's not with you?

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: She's with Flynn!       I mean, totally WITH Flynn -!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Flynn was smart enough to interrogate her first.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: She contains sensitive data. Flynn cannot be allowed to hack her.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Yeah, only -     We kicked Flynn's butt, too.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: You should have seen it.       Flynn won't be a problem.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Then...   Why were you imprisoned?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Delete them all!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: It's a TRAP!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Retreat! Over that way!     Move around their flank!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Arrrgghhh!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I'll never let you forget it.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Rush, we're screwed!    Now everybody's after us!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Nah, we're cool. We're with them!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Awesome!    Can I do one?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Quick.     This way.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Mega, move aside! I will finish him!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Strike us down. There will always be more to oppose you.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: What programming has he installed in you??

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Flynn!   Go with the others!   Run!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: I'm not leaving you with this phreak.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Plexor, get over the control thing.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Drop the disk!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: I'll be damned.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Rush?!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: ARRGH!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Is that all you've got?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Raagghh!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Rush!    This way!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Delete them!

Speaker: boole
Dialogue: This way!   Down the pipe!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: He's better than I thought.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: He's been sent for a reason.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: What reason?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Don't know yet. Sometimes we have to trust the bigger plan.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Mega!   Quick! Jump!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: MEGA!!!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: You committed a fatal error.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Their strategies and tactics lie encrypted in her memory. Bring her! I will hack from her what I need.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I got it, I got it, I got it.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: AWWWWWWW!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Shove it!    Go!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: I remember now! Nothing to it!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Check it out!

Speaker: boole
Dialogue: Look out!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: TURN AROUND!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: I'm cool.    Not a problem.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: They took Mega.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: She can handle herself for a while.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: How do we attack Plexor next?

Speaker: quantz
Dialogue: You're with us now?

Speaker: boole
Dialogue: Do you know hard it is?   Opposing the power of Plexor?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It's like the forty-sixth level of ConquerDome 6.1, while winning a side game of Tetras Ultra, doing six Instant messages and debugging a demo.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: All at the same time.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I'm there.   Krod too.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Say what?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: We're going to need all the help we can get. Boole, can we make it to the dark zone from here?

Speaker: boole
Dialogue: There is one possible route.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: We'll meet up with the code monkeys and combine forces.

Speaker: fighter 1
Dialogue: We gave it everything.

Speaker: fighter 2
Dialogue: Interface.   We can resist.

Speaker: fighter 3
Dialogue: Interface.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Is completion on schedule?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Boot up.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: You treat me like I've been corrupted.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: I cannot predict the random effects Flynn might have caused in you.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: You programmed me to gather intelligence. That's all I've ever done.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: How long have you known Flynn?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Enough time to gain his trust.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Your behavior was highly authentic.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: To him.    It had to be.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Have you allowed Flynn to complete a full interface with you?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I am programmed to allow such access only to you, Plexor.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Flynn claims to be a User.     As did the one called Rush.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Users do not exist.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: You have seen nothing to make you doubt this?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: They possess no powers beyond those of routine Programs?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I have no knowledge of such powers.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Still, there is something about them I cannot compute. Flynn plans to attack me, doesn't he?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Yes. And Rush will fight by his side.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Where will they strike?

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Flynn does not decide until the hour of his attack. But he trusts me completely. When he knows the place, I will know it as well.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Perfect. They will be met with a final thrashing. Yes, let them come.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Have you further instructions for me?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: None for now. But stay close.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: You came to me full of glitches and random routines. Look at you now. What an extraordinary piece of programming I have made of you. I created X-Net to the same standard of flawless beauty. Soon, its perfection will become all that is, and all that ever will be.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: All events remain under your control.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Over there!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Those Programs think they're just being transferred!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Can we take out those X-Net guys?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Our forces are too thin. We can't risk a battle that would reveal this position.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: BT!    JR!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Good to see you guys. When did the X-Net goons start patrolling all the way out here?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Hey guys. This is Rush and his main man Krod. They defected from Plexor's forces to fight with us.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Excellent.   Let's see.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: I've seen that somewhere.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It's the encryption pattern on Plexor's disk.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Good eyes. We've got Mole Programs who score chunks of Plexor's personal code anywhere they can find it. These guys fit the pieces together.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: How many of you crashed?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: The Teraflop Boys?     Algebrat?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Oh Geez.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Time is running out!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Yow. I get tired just watching these dudes.

Dialogue: Just for laughs, try putting the circle on top of the pyramid.

Speaker: code monks
Dialogue: That's incongruous.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: If I'm wrong, ding me.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: What have we got to lose?    Try it.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Not bad.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Good thing you didn't terminate us.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: How do we use this thing to shut down Plexor?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: It's a copy of Plexor's master key. We can break into any X-Net facility and fry the power supply.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: But once Plexor knows we have it, he'll change the code.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Yep.   We've got one shot.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Then we should take out the power supply to Plexor's main server.

Speaker: group
Dialogue: Yes! Take out Plexor's central server!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Hang on, guys, that's not as easy as it sounds -

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I was inside the main server, I saw how it's laid out.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: I used to work there!   I'll recognize where everything is!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Even with this key, it won't -

Speaker: quantz
Dialogue: We can pull it off, can't we Flynn? One final assault on Plexor's central server?

Speaker: boole
Dialogue: Shut him down forever?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Of course we can.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Hey, the future depends on us.    How could we fail?

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: It's almost fixed. I'll be able to bring back Rush soon -

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Excellent work. Unfortunately, I'm shutting down this project.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Something came up. The company is at stake. I can't go into details.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: But Rush would have no way to return!

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Meg. I will never hold you responsible. This is a tough call, but it's mine. Dismantle and destroy all of this equipment and software. Immediately.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Well -

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: Meg...   I'm not asking.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: I understand.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: It's a bummer being on the losing team, huh Rush?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: We'll trash X-Net. Then we'll go back to the our world and expose what Sinclair's done.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Do they have any idea our world exists? Do they understand what a User is?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Programs once connected freely with their Users. But Plexor shut down the I/O ports, severing all links. He controls all contact with the world we once knew. Programs operate on his instructions or none at all.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Or yours.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: It's nothing to brag about.    We're getting our butts kicked.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It there a way to contact Meg? She can transport us back to our world. Maybe it's better if we fight Sinclair on his own turf.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: I gave up the idea of going back a long time ago... You should too.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Sinclair didn't get where he is by being dumb. Even if we survive Plexor's forces in here, Sinclair will make sure we never get back home.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: But...   Meg said -

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: I'm sure she'll do everything she can. It might not be enough.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Oh, man.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell anyone it was this bad?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Rush. I think Meg suspects the truth about Sinclair.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I thought she hated me.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: She believed in you more than you believed in yourself.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Do we really have a shot at winning against Plexor?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: We have his master key. And we have Mega working on the inside.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Mega... Are you sure about her? I get the feeling she plays both sides.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Plexor programmed her to perform his will. He's a control freak. I'm not. I programmed her to have a will of her own. Whatever she decides, it's up to her.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Sounds dangerous.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Sometimes you've got to trust the bigger plan.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Guys... Rush is right about our final attack. If we've only got one shot, we should go for Plexor's central server. If we insert the hologon key in the main power supply, we can trigger a meltdown. Plexor will be have his best troops standing in our way.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: I turbo-charged him to burn hot and burn fast. Who else could handle the operating code in this disk?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: You.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Uhhh, I don't think so.

Speaker: boole
Dialogue: It could mean the difference between winning and losing.

Dialogue: Hey, I'll try.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: What do I do - ?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Yow!

Dialogue: Steady. It's all about giving as much as you get. Let it become a part of you.

Dialogue: Awesome, dude! Don't let go!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: HE DID IT!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Damn, look at that...     He did it.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: It feels...    Awesome.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Don't flinch, Rush!   It's your disk now.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Oh man, this is good.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Awwwww!   Where can I get one of those?

Speaker: boole
Dialogue: It's for real, Quantz.

Speaker: quantz
Dialogue: We've got a chance to take down Plexor.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Perfect. Any three of you could crash an army of Flynn's best. But I've prepare for his random acts by designing massive redundancy.

Dialogue: Dewey.   This your idea of a joke?

Dialogue: Cybavor programming complete?

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Demonstrate.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Install yourself over there.

Dialogue: Attack!

Speaker: plexor

Dialogue: I-beem!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: We're taking out Plexor.    You with us or them?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: There.   You can make it across!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: No, take Mega! I'll stay here and run interference.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: You haven't got a chance by yourself.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Ah, these guys are wimps.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: We're not leaving you.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: My body is weak, but my will is strong. I promise, no matter what they do to me, I'll survive this. Trust the bigger plan.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: But Flynn -

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: GO!   NOW!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Flynn. Your moment of obsolescence is upon you.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Freedom, Plexor. It's the better idea. That's why Mega chose my side.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: If an idea is erased from all memory banks, it can be neither good nor bad. When each alternative has been removed, X-Net will simply BE.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Crash me. Hack me. Do what you want. The yearning for freedom will last forever.

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Nice speech... USER!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Noooooo!!!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Over there!    Surround them!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: We plug this into the control cell, X-Net is history.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Let's do it for Flynn.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: NOW!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Over there!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: AAARRGGGHHH!

Speaker: plexor
Dialogue: Where did you get that?!   No one knows this code but me!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Your software has the biggest flaw there is, Plexor. You can't see you own mistakes.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Do it Mega!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: RUSH!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Now who's obsolete?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Thanks guys.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: I'll never let you forget it.

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: We're free.     At last we're free. 107

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: In a world exposed to increasing data corruption, I hereby switch on the first global network offering 100% guaranteed data security. Flawless performance, zero downtime. The world works hard, the world deserves...

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: X-NET!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: I underestimated you.   Thanks.

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: You knew she always liked him.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Whoa, ouch, what?       Ahhhhh!

Speaker: mega
Dialogue: Rush, what is it?

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Guys!   Mega!     NOOO!

Speaker: krod
Dialogue: Help him!

Speaker: quantz
Dialogue: It's the way it should be.

Speaker: boole
Dialogue: He's going back to the place he belongs.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Rush.   You made it!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Like a bad cold, I'm always coming back.

Speaker: voices
Dialogue: He made it!    Rush! You okay?!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: I met a program you wrote. She's just as incredibly beautiful and confusing as you.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: I know. Mega told me all about what you did in there.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: She gave you my coordinates.     That's how you uploaded me?

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Yes.   Your coordinates...     and his.

Speaker: the guy
Dialogue: She's done an amazing job here, Rush.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Flynn!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: I told you to trust the bigger plan.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: I'd come to suspect Flynn was alive, inside. But I had no way to know for sure.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: You picked the right guy to send in.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Working down here, I became convinced someone tried to murder Flynn. But the only person I could confide in was the guy I suspected most.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: What are you people doing down here!?! Get back to work! X-Net has CRASHED! We'll all be ruined!

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Speak for yourself, Sinclair.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: I ordered you to destroy this equipment!

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Hey, jerk, she doesn't do your dirty work. Neither do I. Not anymore. You lied to me, to all of us. You want to deal with somebody? I'm the guy who crashed X-Net.

Speaker: sinclair
Dialogue: You're fired, everybody get out.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: No, Sinclair. I'm back. And I'm the boss again. You're fired. Not only are you fired, you're going to have a lot of explaining to do to the SEC, the Justice Department and the FBI.  Hold him until the police get here.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: X-Net is dead. But Encom lives. We're going to bring this company back to its place as the leader in finding the next big thing. I'll need to be free to do the dreaming. So, effective immediately, I'm appointing two bold, bright, courageous people to head worldwide operations.

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: You both earned it.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: Cool.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: I love it.

Speaker: rush
Dialogue: We'll take it.  You get a division to run.

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Yes.  Does that mean a bigger cubicle?

Speaker: flynn
Dialogue: Put on some coffee. You two are going to be putting in a lot of overtime together.

Speaker: meg
Dialogue: Do you remember how, along time ago, you used to give me a professional congratulatory peck on the cheek?
